citations.narrative:
On the exterior fence fabric of the gibbon enclosure there is a finer mesh material. The top portion of this mesh is secured
however, the lower portion is detached and curling outward. This detached area should be secured to ensure that the
enclosure is in good repair.
Primary enclosures must be designed and constructed of suitable materials so that they are structurally sound for the
species of nonhuman primates contained in them. They must be kept in good repair.
TO BE CORRECTED BY: JULY 6, 2023

THE FOLLOWING ITEMS ARE IN NEED OF REPAIR:
* The exterior base of the serval shelter has deteriorated wood. The corner of this same section has rotted and
deteriorated wood thus leaving a hole in the shelter wall. This hole could allow the entrance of unwanted animals and/or
vermin. This shelter should be repaired to ensure that the building is structurally sound and in good repair.
* The stockade gate, adjacent to the pig enclosure, is missing at least two pickets, thus leaving the gate in disrepair.
The indoor and outdoor housing facilities shall be structurally sound and shall be maintained in good repair to protect the
animals from injury and to contain the animals.
TO BE CORRECTED BY: JULY 14, 2023

Weeds are growing in the gutter above the tiger viewing window. Additionally, the leaf guard inside of this same gutter has
become dislodged. Weeds and plants, as well as the dislodged leaf guard, can block the flow of excess water and affect
the efficiency of the gutter to eliminate water.
Premises (buildings and grounds) shall be kept clean and in good repair in order to protect the animals from injury and to
facilitate the prescribed husbandry practices set forth in this subpart.

The black vultures were again observed on the primary fence of the Asiatic Bear as well as on the grounds of the primary
enclosure. These birds present a health hazard with their droppings in and around the bear enclosure. According to staff,
methods to remove the birds have been attempted but have not been very effective.
A safe and effective program for the control of insects, ectoparasites, and avian and mammalian pests shall be
established and maintained.
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.80(a)(1) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
On the exterior fence fabric of the gibbon enclosure there is a finer mesh material. The top portion of this mesh is secured 
however, the lower portion is detached and curling outward. This detached area should be secured to ensure that the 
enclosure is in good repair.  
 
Primary enclosures must be designed and constructed of suitable materials so that they are structurally sound for the 
species of nonhuman primates contained in them. They must be kept in good repair. 
 
TO BE CORRECTED BY: JULY 6, 2023 
3.125(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
THE FOLLOWING ITEMS ARE IN NEED OF REPAIR: 
 
* The exterior base of the serval shelter has deteriorated wood. The corner of this same section has rotted and 
deteriorated wood thus leaving a hole in the shelter wall. This hole could allow the entrance of unwanted animals and/or 
vermin. This shelter should be repaired to ensure that the building is structurally sound and in good repair. 
 
* The stockade gate, adjacent to the pig enclosure, is missing at least two pickets, thus leaving the gate in disrepair. 
 
The indoor and outdoor housing facilities shall be structurally sound and shall be maintained in good repair to protect the 
animals from injury and to contain the animals. 
 
TO BE CORRECTED BY: JULY 14, 2023 
3.131(c)  Repeat
   
Sanitation. 
Weeds are growing in the gutter above the tiger viewing window. Additionally, the leaf guard inside of this same gutter has 
become dislodged. Weeds and plants, as well as the dislodged leaf guard, can block the flow of excess water and affect

the efficiency of the gutter to eliminate water. 
 
Premises (buildings and grounds) shall be kept clean and in good repair in order to protect the animals from injury and to 
facilitate the prescribed husbandry practices set forth in this subpart. 
3.131(d)  Repeat
   
Sanitation. 
The black vultures were again observed on the primary fence of the Asiatic Bear as well as on the grounds of the primary 
enclosure. These birds present a health hazard with their droppings in and around the bear enclosure. According to staff, 
methods to remove the birds have been attempted but have not been very effective.  
 
A safe and effective program for the control of insects, ectoparasites, and avian and mammalian pests shall be 
established and maintained. 
 
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the facility representative.

species.common: DOMESTIC PIG / POTBELLY PIG / MICRO PIG
